Testament.definition: an act by which a person determines the disposition of his or her property after death [a of property] 2
Testament.origin: [Latin testamentum , from testari to call as a witness, make a will, from testis witness]

1.definition: an act by which a person determines the disposition of his or her property after death [a of property]

2.note: A testament was formerly concerned specifically with personal property, as in the phraselast will and testament. Now a will covers both personal and real property and the termswillandtestamentare generally synonymous, but the phrase lives on.
